00037 const char *CommandAttrGet::ms_usage[] = {
00038   "attrget <file> <name> [int|short|long]",
00039   "  This command issues a ATTRGET request to Hyperspace.",
00040   (const char *)0

00044 int CommandAttrGet::run() {
00045   uint64_t handle;
00046   int error;
00047   DynamicBuffer value(0);
00048 
00049   if (m_args.size() < 2 || m_args.size() > 3) {
00050     cerr << "Wrong number of arguments.  Type 'help' for usage." << endl;
00051     return -1;
00052   }
00053 
00054   if (m_args[0].second != "" || m_args[1].second != "") {
00055     cerr << "Invalid character '=' in argument." << endl;
00056     return -1;
00057   }
00058 
00059   if (!Util::get_handle(m_args[0].first, &handle))
00060     return -1;
00061 
00062   if ((error = m_session->attr_get(handle, m_args[1].first, value)) == Error::OK) {
00063     if (m_args.size() == 3) {
00064       if (m_args[2].first == "short") {
00065         if (value.fill() != 2) {
00066           cerr << "Expected 2 byte short, but got " << value.fill() << " bytes" << endl;
00067           return Error::HYPERSPACE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE;
00068         }
00069         short sval;
00070         memcpy(&sval, value.base, 2);
00071         cout << sval << endl;
00072       }
00073       else if (m_args[2].first == "int") {
00074         if (value.fill() != 4) {
00075           cerr << "Expected 4 byte int, but got " << value.fill() << " bytes" << endl;
00076           return Error::HYPERSPACE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE;
00077         }
00078         uint32_t ival;
00079         memcpy(&ival, value.base, 4);
00080         cout << ival << endl;
00081       }
00082       else if (m_args[2].first == "long") {
00083         if (value.fill() != 8) {
00084           cerr << "Expected 8 byte int, but got " << value.fill() << " bytes" << endl;
00085           return Error::HYPERSPACE_BAD_ATTRIBUTE;
00086         }
00087         uint64_t lval;
00088         memcpy(&lval, value.base, 8);
00089         cout << lval << endl;
00090       }
00091     }
00092     else {
00093       std::string valstr = std::string((const char *)value.base, value.fill());
00094       cout << valstr << endl;
00095     }
00096   }
00097 
00098   return error;
00099 }
